statement: In a contest with problems A, B, C, 25 students solved at least one problem. Among those who did not solve A, the number who solved B was twice the number who solved C. The number who solved only A was one more than the number who solved A and at least one other problem. Among those who solved just one problem, half did not solve A. How many students solved only problem B?
Let a, b, c be the side lengths of a triangle and α, β, γ the opposite angles. Prove that if a + b = tan(γ/2)(a tan α + b tan β), then the triangle is isosceles.

Prove that the sum of the distances of the vertices of a regular tetrahedron from the center of its circumscribed sphere is less than the sum of the distances of these vertices from any other point in space.
Prove that for every natural number n and every real x ≠ kπ/2^t (t = 0,1,...,n; k any integer), 1/sin 2x + 1/sin 4x + ... + 1/sin 2^n x = cot x - cot 2^n x.

Solve the system |a₁−a₂|x₂ + |a₁−a₃|x₃ + |a₁−a₄|x₄ = 1, |a₂−a₁|x₁ + |a₂−a₃|x₃ + |a₂−a₄|x₄ = 1, |a₃−a₁|x₁ + |a₃−a₂|x₂ + |a₃−a₄|x₄ = 1, |a₄−a₁|x₁ + |a₄−a₂|x₂ + |a₄−a₃|x₃ = 1, where a₁, a₂, a₃, a₄ are four distinct real numbers.
Points K, L, M are chosen inside sides BC, CA, AB of triangle ABC respectively. Prove that the area of at least one of the triangles AML, BKM, CLK is ≤ one quarter of the area of triangle ABC.
